Kajol Recalls Childhood Memories, Says She Was Petrified Of Her Mother Tanuja
Kajol Recalls Childhood Memories, Says She Was Petrified Of Her Mother Tanuja
Kajol is fun, fearless and unapologetic. The actress is always honest in her opinions and that's what makes her different from the rest of the clan. And now she's all set to release her upcoming film, Helicoper Eela, which is about a singer mother and her relationship with her son.
Screengrab
The trailer has got many people talking about how this film could be a game changer for Kajol after a string of flops with Dilwale and VIP too. The actress has been promoting it as her husband Ajay Devgan is producing it and she is having fun sharing her fashion and recalling her own tales with her mother.
Speaking about her own mother, yesteryear actress Tanuja, to an online portal, Kajol says, "I was petrified of her. I wouldn't put one toe out of line if I knew she didn't approve of it."

My mother was one of the most forward thinking people. I had the most amazing upbringing because of it. Topics like compassion, anger, forgiveness and death were discussed. Most things were not hidden. We were always told to take the most tolerant route and that revenge doesn't get you anything, she ws further quoted as saying.
During the trailer launch of Eela Helicopter too, Kajol mentioned how her mother was legendary with abuses and had the most creative ones but when Kajol pointed it out as a child, Tanuja stopped swearing.
Appreciating her mom, Kajol said, "My mother always lead by example and that's what makes her the best.
She reiterated that she's learnt and understood the value of a mother when she became one. Eela helicoper is releasing today and is directed by Pradeep Sarkar.
